title: AI Devices
no_devices_description: Connect your local device to start using it with Wegent
instructions: Devices will appear automatically after starting and logging in locally
one_step_title: Just one step to connect your device
one_step_description: Run the following command in your terminal to install and connect
install_command_description: Run the following command to install and connect your device:
select_device_hint: Select a device from the top to start sending tasks
device_offline_hint: Device is offline, please select another
device_offline_cannot_send: Device is offline, cannot send tasks
device_busy_hint: Device is busy with another task
select_another_device: Please select another device or wait for current task to complete
set_default_success: {{name}} has been set as the default device
slots_full_hint: All task slots are in use. Close a task to start a new one.
close_session_confirm_description: Are you sure you want to close the session for task "{{taskTitle}}" on device "{{deviceName}}"? This will terminate the Claude Code process and free up the device slot.
local_executor_description: Run Executor on your Mac to execute AI tasks
local_executor_description_linux: Run Executor on your Linux machine to execute AI tasks
local_executor_description_windows: Run Executor on your Windows PC to execute AI tasks
step_install_desc: Run the one-liner install script, automatically downloads and installs to ~/.wegent-executor/bin/
step_install_desc_windows: Run the PowerShell install script, automatically downloads and installs to %USERPROFILE%\.wegent-executor\bin\
step_download_desc: Download the executable for your Mac from GitHub
step_permission_desc: Grant execution permission to the file
step_run_desc: Start Executor with the following command
security_warning: Security notice: Do not share the command above, it contains your authentication credentials
gatekeeper_hint: First run may require allowing it in System Settings > Privacy & Security
windows_security_hint: First run may require allowing it in Windows Security. Requires Windows 10 version 1809 or later
token_expiry_hint: The auth token expires in 7 days. Re-run the startup command to refresh it
apikey_existing_warning: You selected an existing API Key. For security reasons, the full key value is only shown once at creation. If you haven't saved this key, please create a new one.
apikey_benefit_hint: API Key does not expire. Use it for long-running device connections without re-authentication.
create_apikey_desc: Create an API Key for device authentication
no_local_devices: No local devices connected. Add a device using the guide above.
